paper_abstract: A number of different Fuzzy Answer Set Programming (FASP) formalisms have been proposed in the last years, which all differ in the language extensions they support. In this paper we investigate the expressivity of these frameworks. Specifically we show how a variety of constructs in these languages can be implemented using a considerably simpler core language. These simulations are important as a compact and simple language is easier to implement and to reason about, while an expressive language offers more options when modeling problems. paper_title: A core language for fuzzy answer set programming
